name: Paul Kagame
shortBio: President of Rwanda since 2000, known for Rwanda's economic transformation and recovery post-genocide
longBio: Paul Kagame is the President of Rwanda, widely recognized for his leadership in transforming Rwanda post-genocide. He is known for his efforts in rebuilding the country's economy and ensuring social stability.
achievements: Led the post-genocide recovery in Rwanda.
Initiated the Vision 2020 program to transform Rwanda's economy.

name: Abiy Ahmed Ali
shortBio: Prime Minister of Ethiopia, awarded the 2019 Nobel Peace Prize for ending the Eritrean border conflict
longBio: Abiy Ahmed Ali, Prime Minister of Ethiopia, was awarded the 2019 Nobel Peace Prize for his role in ending the Eritrean-Ethiopian conflict. His reforms aim to modernize the Ethiopian economy and society.
achievements: Awarded the 2019 Nobel Peace Prize.
Initiated economic and political reforms in Ethiopia.

name: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala
shortBio: Director-General of the WTO and former Nigerian finance minister, known for her economic expertise.
longBio: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala is the Director-General of the World Trade Organization and a former Nigerian finance minister. Known for her economic expertise, she is a strong advocate for global economic reform.
achievements: First female and first African Director-General of the WTO.
Led Nigeria’s economic recovery efforts as Finance Minister.

name: Cyril Ramaphosa
shortBio: President of South Africa since 2018, former anti-apartheid activist, and businessman focused on economic growth.
longBio: Cyril Ramaphosa, President of South Africa since 2018, is a renowned anti-apartheid activist, union leader, and businessman who has focused on implementing economic reforms and addressing inequality.
achievements: Instrumental in the anti-apartheid negotiations.
Implemented economic reforms to address inequality in South Africa.

name: Amina Mohammed
shortBio: Deputy President of Kenya, former Cabinet Secretary for Foreign Affairs, and international advocate for climate and trade.
longBio: Amina Mohammed is Kenya’s Deputy President and a former Cabinet Secretary for Foreign Affairs. She is an advocate for international climate action and sustainable trade.
achievements: Pioneered Kenya’s foreign policy on climate and trade.
Led international advocacy on sustainable development goals.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
shortBio: President of Nigeria from 2015-2023, focused on anti-corruption, security, and economic reforms.
longBio: Muhammadu Buhari, President of Nigeria from May 2015 - May 2023, has prioritized anti-corruption measures, security, and economic reforms throughout his tenure.
achievements: Led Nigeria’s anti-corruption campaign.
Implemented economic and security reforms.

name: Goodluck Jonathan
shortBio: Former President of Nigeria, known for democratic reforms and infrastructure development.
longBio: Goodluck Jonathan, former President of Nigeria, is known for advancing democratic reforms and prioritizing infrastructure development during his administration.
achievements: Advanced democratic processes and electoral reforms.
Promoted infrastructure projects across Nigeria.

name: Uhuru Kenyatta
shortBio: Former President of Kenya, focused on infrastructure, economic growth, and regional security.
longBio: Uhuru Kenyatta, former President of Kenya, is noted for his focus on economic growth, regional security, and major infrastructure projects across Kenya.
achievements: Championed major infrastructure projects.
Strengthened Kenya’s economic and security ties.

name: Bola Tinubu
shortBio: President of Nigeria, former Lagos State governor, and political kingmaker.
longBio: Bola Tinubu, Nigeria’s President, is known for his political strategy and influence, having served as Lagos State governor and played a major role in political leadership transitions.
achievements: Led Lagos State as governor, initiating economic growth.
Influential political figure in Nigerian governance.

name: Raila Odinga
shortBio: Opposition leader and former Prime Minister of Kenya, advocate for democracy and social reforms.
longBio: Raila Odinga, widely known as 'Baba,' has been a prominent figure in Kenya’s political landscape as a former Prime Minister and a vocal advocate for democracy and social reforms.
achievements: Former Prime Minister of Kenya.
Vocal advocate for democracy and social reforms.

name: Aisha Buhari
shortBio: First Lady of Nigeria, active in women's empowerment, youth development, and healthcare.
longBio: Aisha Buhari, First Lady of Nigeria, is known for her initiatives in women's empowerment, youth development, and healthcare reform, advocating for a better society.
achievements: Prominent in women's empowerment and healthcare reforms.
Advocated for youth development in Nigeria.

name: Samia Suluhu Hassan
shortBio: First female president of Tanzania, committed to advancing gender equality and strengthening the Tanzanian economy.
longBio: Samia Suluhu Hassan, affectionately called 'Mama Samia,' is the first female president of Tanzania, with a focus on gender equality and economic growth for the nation.
achievements: First female president of Tanzania.
Promoted healthcare and education reforms.

name: Rochas Okorocha
shortBio: Nigerian senator, former governor of Imo State, and education advocate.
longBio: Rochas Okorocha, known as 'Owelle,' is a Nigerian senator and former governor of Imo State, recognized for his initiatives in education and youth empowerment.
achievements: Former governor of Imo State.
Advocated for education reform and youth empowerment.

name: Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf
shortBio: Africa's first elected female head of state, led Liberia through post-war recovery and was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.
longBio: Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf, known as 'Africa's Iron Lady,' is celebrated as Africa's first elected female president, recognized for her Nobel-winning efforts in peace and gender equality.
achievements: First female president in Africa.
Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for her work in promoting peace and gender equality.

name: Florence Ita-Giwa
shortBio: Former senator from Cross River State, focused on women’s welfare and healthcare development.
longBio: Florence Ita-Giwa, affectionately called 'Mama Bakassi,' is a former Nigerian senator and advocate for women's welfare and healthcare, especially in the Bakassi region.
achievements: Advocated for women's welfare and healthcare.
Focused on Bakassi region development.

name: Martha Karua
shortBio: Former Minister of Justice and deputy president candidate in Kenya, known for anti-corruption and human rights advocacy.
longBio: Martha Karua, often called Kenya's 'Iron Lady,' is a staunch advocate for anti-corruption and human rights, with a distinguished career as a former Minister of Justice.
achievements: Former Minister of Justice in Kenya.
Known for anti-corruption and human rights advocacy.
